comment.body: You'd better also add `--ui_restrict YOU_phone_ip` or anyone in your local network can access your ZeroNet, check `python zeronet.py --help` for more info
Here are [some opinions](?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1519145389) for ICO or monetization on ZeroNet from the main dev Nofish

It's because ZeroMe image uploading uses an unsafe technique and Torbrowser, Firefox >58 deactivate it in default. You can check [my writing](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:56) for solution

Here is [ZeroNet Mobile Guide](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:7_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h). And my new writing: [My ZeroNet Mobile Setup](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:86) :D But I agree that we still need a better Android app
@Chikan: that picture was generated by the browser and you failed to upload yours at that time, could you upload a new picture with the same browser?
@Thunder33345: Diaspora* doesn't has such a feature, but it's in ZeroNet main dev Nofish's todo list ;)

@Thunder: @x86128: ZeroMe hub has 3 kinds of content.json, the one for specific user can't be signed inside slider (config panel), it needs cmd like `python2 zeronet.py siteSign $SITE --inner_path data/users/$USER/content.json`, or call the ZeroFrame cmd in browser console, you can find some details in official doc.

@Eaglex: maybe I picked a wrong word, it means the widget is very buggy and can create many unexpected results when using it
@jad: no problem! Thanks for sharing my site :D
@Shaswata56: "Ailen on planet earth!" from op's profile XD

> Zero. Possibly even negative large integer. By the very first blink of my Commodore 64's light blue block cursor, my interest had already slammed through the ceiling! ...

So romantic

For my vps in Germany, I suffered similar issue when directly trying to log in, but when I wanted to write an invoice on the contact page, the website suggested me to try login first, I clicked the login link from that page, and it worked.
